60/**
61 * SECTION:hb-ot-layout
62 * @title: hb-ot-layout
63 * @short_description: OpenType Layout
64 * @include: hb-ot.h
65 *
66 * Functions for querying OpenType Layout features in the font face.
67 **/
68
69
70/*
71 * kern
72 */
73
74#ifndef HB_NO_OT_KERN
75/**
76 * hb_ot_layout_has_kerning:
77 * @face: The #hb_face_t to work on
78 *
79 * Tests whether a face includes any kerning data in the 'kern' table.
80 * Does NOT test for kerning lookups in the GPOS table.
81 *
82 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
83 *
84 **/
85bool
86hb_ot_layout_has_kerning (hb_face_t *face)
87{
88 return face->table.kern->has_data ();
89}
90
91/**
92 * hb_ot_layout_has_machine_kerning:
93 * @face: The #hb_face_t to work on
94 *
95 * Tests whether a face includes any state-machine kerning in the 'kern' table.
96 * Does NOT examine the GPOS table.
97 *
98 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
99 *
100 **/
101bool
102hb_ot_layout_has_machine_kerning (hb_face_t *face)
103{
104 return face->table.kern->has_state_machine ();
105}
106
107/**
108 * hb_ot_layout_has_cross_kerning:
109 * @face: The #hb_face_t to work on
110 *
111 * Tests whether a face has any cross-stream kerning (i.e., kerns
112 * that make adjustments perpendicular to the direction of the text
113 * flow: Y adjustments in horizontal text or X adjustments in
114 * vertical text) in the 'kern' table.
115 *
116 * Does NOT examine the GPOS table.
117 *
118 * Return value: `true` is data found, `false` otherwise
119 *
120 **/
121bool
122hb_ot_layout_has_cross_kerning (hb_face_t *face)
123{
124 return face->table.kern->has_cross_stream ();
125}
126
127void
128hb_ot_layout_kern (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
129 hb_font_t *font,
130 hb_buffer_t *buffer)
131{
132 hb_blob_t *blob = font->face->table.kern.get_blob ();
133 const AAT::kern& kern = *blob->as<AAT::kern> ();
134
135 AAT::hb_aat_apply_context_t c (plan, font, buffer, blob);
136
137 if (!buffer->message (font, fmt: "start table kern")) return;
138 kern.apply (c: &c);
139 (void) buffer->message (font, fmt: "end table kern");
140}
141#endif
142
143
144/*
145 * GDEF
146 */
147
148bool
149OT::GDEF::is_blocklisted (hb_blob_t *blob,
150 hb_face_t *face) const
151{
152#ifdef HB_NO_OT_LAYOUT_BLOCKLIST
153 return false;
154#endif
155 /* The ugly business of blocklisting individual fonts' tables happen here!
156 * See this thread for why we finally had to bend in and do this:
157 * https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/harfbuzz/2016-February/005489.html
158 *
159 * In certain versions of Times New Roman Italic and Bold Italic,
160 * ASCII double quotation mark U+0022 has wrong glyph class 3 (mark)
161 * in GDEF. Many versions of Tahoma have bad GDEF tables that
162 * incorrectly classify some spacing marks such as certain IPA
163 * symbols as glyph class 3. So do older versions of Microsoft
164 * Himalaya, and the version of Cantarell shipped by Ubuntu 16.04.
165 *
166 * Nuke the GDEF tables of to avoid unwanted width-zeroing.
167 *
168 * See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1279925
169 * https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1279693
170 * https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1279875
171 */
172 switch HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3(blob->length,
173 face->table.GSUB->table.get_length (),
174 face->table.GPOS->table.get_length ())
175 {
176 /* sha1sum:c5ee92f0bca4bfb7d06c4d03e8cf9f9cf75d2e8a Windows 7? timesi.ttf */
177 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (442, 2874, 42038):
178 /* sha1sum:37fc8c16a0894ab7b749e35579856c73c840867b Windows 7? timesbi.ttf */
179 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (430, 2874, 40662):
180 /* sha1sum:19fc45110ea6cd3cdd0a5faca256a3797a069a80 Windows 7 timesi.ttf */
181 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (442, 2874, 39116):
182 /* sha1sum:6d2d3c9ed5b7de87bc84eae0df95ee5232ecde26 Windows 7 timesbi.ttf */
183 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (430, 2874, 39374):
184 /* sha1sum:8583225a8b49667c077b3525333f84af08c6bcd8 OS X 10.11.3 Times New Roman Italic.ttf */
185 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (490, 3046, 41638):
186 /* sha1sum:ec0f5a8751845355b7c3271d11f9918a966cb8c9 OS X 10.11.3 Times New Roman Bold Italic.ttf */
187 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (478, 3046, 41902):
188 /* sha1sum:96eda93f7d33e79962451c6c39a6b51ee893ce8c tahoma.ttf from Windows 8 */
189 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (898, 12554, 46470):
190 /* sha1sum:20928dc06014e0cd120b6fc942d0c3b1a46ac2bc tahomabd.ttf from Windows 8 */
191 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (910, 12566, 47732):
192 /* sha1sum:4f95b7e4878f60fa3a39ca269618dfde9721a79e tahoma.ttf from Windows 8.1 */
193 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (928, 23298, 59332):
194 /* sha1sum:6d400781948517c3c0441ba42acb309584b73033 tahomabd.ttf from Windows 8.1 */
195 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (940, 23310, 60732):
196 /* tahoma.ttf v6.04 from Windows 8.1 x64, see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1279925 */
197 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (964, 23836, 60072):
198 /* tahomabd.ttf v6.04 from Windows 8.1 x64, see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1279925 */
199 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (976, 23832, 61456):
200 /* sha1sum:e55fa2dfe957a9f7ec26be516a0e30b0c925f846 tahoma.ttf from Windows 10 */
201 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (994, 24474, 60336):
202 /* sha1sum:7199385abb4c2cc81c83a151a7599b6368e92343 tahomabd.ttf from Windows 10 */
203 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1006, 24470, 61740):
204 /* tahoma.ttf v6.91 from Windows 10 x64, see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1279925 */
205 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1006, 24576, 61346):
206 /* tahomabd.ttf v6.91 from Windows 10 x64, see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1279925 */
207 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1018, 24572, 62828):
208 /* sha1sum:b9c84d820c49850d3d27ec498be93955b82772b5 tahoma.ttf from Windows 10 AU */
209 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1006, 24576, 61352):
210 /* sha1sum:2bdfaab28174bdadd2f3d4200a30a7ae31db79d2 tahomabd.ttf from Windows 10 AU */
211 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1018, 24572, 62834):
212 /* sha1sum:b0d36cf5a2fbe746a3dd277bffc6756a820807a7 Tahoma.ttf from Mac OS X 10.9 */
213 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (832, 7324, 47162):
214 /* sha1sum:12fc4538e84d461771b30c18b5eb6bd434e30fba Tahoma Bold.ttf from Mac OS X 10.9 */
215 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (844, 7302, 45474):
216 /* sha1sum:eb8afadd28e9cf963e886b23a30b44ab4fd83acc himalaya.ttf from Windows 7 */
217 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (180, 13054, 7254):
218 /* sha1sum:73da7f025b238a3f737aa1fde22577a6370f77b0 himalaya.ttf from Windows 8 */
219 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (192, 12638, 7254):
220 /* sha1sum:6e80fd1c0b059bbee49272401583160dc1e6a427 himalaya.ttf from Windows 8.1 */
221 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (192, 12690, 7254):
222 /* 8d9267aea9cd2c852ecfb9f12a6e834bfaeafe44 cantarell-fonts-0.0.21/otf/Cantarell-Regular.otf */
223 /* 983988ff7b47439ab79aeaf9a45bd4a2c5b9d371 cantarell-fonts-0.0.21/otf/Cantarell-Oblique.otf */
224 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (188, 248, 3852):
225 /* 2c0c90c6f6087ffbfea76589c93113a9cbb0e75f cantarell-fonts-0.0.21/otf/Cantarell-Bold.otf */
226 /* 55461f5b853c6da88069ffcdf7f4dd3f8d7e3e6b cantarell-fonts-0.0.21/otf/Cantarell-Bold-Oblique.otf */
227 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (188, 264, 3426):
228 /* d125afa82a77a6475ac0e74e7c207914af84b37a padauk-2.80/Padauk.ttf RHEL 7.2 */
229 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1058, 47032, 11818):
230 /* 0f7b80437227b90a577cc078c0216160ae61b031 padauk-2.80/Padauk-Bold.ttf RHEL 7.2*/
231 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1046, 47030, 12600):
232 /* d3dde9aa0a6b7f8f6a89ef1002e9aaa11b882290 padauk-2.80/Padauk.ttf Ubuntu 16.04 */
233 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1058, 71796, 16770):
234 /* 5f3c98ccccae8a953be2d122c1b3a77fd805093f padauk-2.80/Padauk-Bold.ttf Ubuntu 16.04 */
235 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1046, 71790, 17862):
236 /* 6c93b63b64e8b2c93f5e824e78caca555dc887c7 padauk-2.80/Padauk-book.ttf */
237 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1046, 71788, 17112):
238 /* d89b1664058359b8ec82e35d3531931125991fb9 padauk-2.80/Padauk-bookbold.ttf */
239 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1058, 71794, 17514):
240 /* 824cfd193aaf6234b2b4dc0cf3c6ef576c0d00ef padauk-3.0/Padauk-book.ttf */
241 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1330, 109904, 57938):
242 /* 91fcc10cf15e012d27571e075b3b4dfe31754a8a padauk-3.0/Padauk-bookbold.ttf */
243 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1330, 109904, 58972):
244 /* sha1sum: c26e41d567ed821bed997e937bc0c41435689e85 Padauk.ttf
245 * "Padauk Regular" "Version 2.5", see https://crbug.com/681813 */
246 case HB_CODEPOINT_ENCODE3 (1004, 59092, 14836):
247 return true;
248 }
249 return false;
250}
251
252static void
253_hb_ot_layout_set_glyph_props (hb_font_t *font,
254 hb_buffer_t *buffer)
255{
256 _hb_buffer_assert_gsubgpos_vars (buffer);
257
258 const OT::GDEF &gdef = *font->face->table.GDEF->table;
259 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
260 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
261 {
262 _hb_glyph_info_set_glyph_props (info: &buffer->info[i], props: gdef.get_glyph_props (glyph: buffer->info[i].codepoint));
263 _hb_glyph_info_clear_lig_props (info: &buffer->info[i]);
264 }
265}
266
267/* Public API */
268
269/**
270 * hb_ot_layout_has_glyph_classes:
271 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
272 *
273 * Tests whether a face has any glyph classes defined in its GDEF table.
274 *
275 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
276 *
277 **/
278hb_bool_t
279hb_ot_layout_has_glyph_classes (hb_face_t *face)
280{
281 return face->table.GDEF->table->has_glyph_classes ();
282}
283
284/**
285 * hb_ot_layout_get_glyph_class:
286 * @face: The #hb_face_t to work on
287 * @glyph: The #hb_codepoint_t code point to query
288 *
289 * Fetches the GDEF class of the requested glyph in the specified face.
290 *
291 * Return value: The #hb_ot_layout_glyph_class_t glyph class of the given code
292 * point in the GDEF table of the face.
293 *
294 * Since: 0.9.7
295 **/
296hb_ot_layout_glyph_class_t
297hb_ot_layout_get_glyph_class (hb_face_t *face,
298 hb_codepoint_t glyph)
299{
300 return (hb_ot_layout_glyph_class_t) face->table.GDEF->table->get_glyph_class (glyph);
301}
302
303/**
304 * hb_ot_layout_get_glyphs_in_class:
305 * @face: The #hb_face_t to work on
306 * @klass: The #hb_ot_layout_glyph_class_t GDEF class to retrieve
307 * @glyphs: (out): The #hb_set_t set of all glyphs belonging to the requested
308 * class.
309 *
310 * Retrieves the set of all glyphs from the face that belong to the requested
311 * glyph class in the face's GDEF table.
312 *
313 * Since: 0.9.7
314 **/
315void
316hb_ot_layout_get_glyphs_in_class (hb_face_t *face,
317 hb_ot_layout_glyph_class_t klass,
318 hb_set_t *glyphs /* OUT */)
319{
320 return face->table.GDEF->table->get_glyphs_in_class (klass, glyphs);
321}
322
323#ifndef HB_NO_LAYOUT_UNUSED
324/**
325 * hb_ot_layout_get_attach_points:
326 * @face: The #hb_face_t to work on
327 * @glyph: The #hb_codepoint_t code point to query
328 * @start_offset: offset of the first attachment point to retrieve
329 * @point_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of attachment points to return;
330 * Output = the actual number of attachment points returned (may be zero)
331 * @point_array: (out) (array length=point_count): The array of attachment points found for the query
332 *
333 * Fetches a list of all attachment points for the specified glyph in the GDEF
334 * table of the face. The list returned will begin at the offset provided.
335 *
336 * Useful if the client program wishes to cache the list.
337 *
338 * Return value: Total number of attachment points for @glyph.
339 *
340 **/
341unsigned int
342hb_ot_layout_get_attach_points (hb_face_t *face,
343 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
344 unsigned int start_offset,
345 unsigned int *point_count /* IN/OUT */,
346 unsigned int *point_array /* OUT */)
347{
348 return face->table.GDEF->table->get_attach_points (glyph_id: glyph,
349 start_offset,
350 point_count,
351 point_array);
352}
353/**
354 * hb_ot_layout_get_ligature_carets:
355 * @font: The #hb_font_t to work on
356 * @direction: The #hb_direction_t text direction to use
357 * @glyph: The #hb_codepoint_t code point to query
358 * @start_offset: offset of the first caret position to retrieve
359 * @caret_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of caret positions to return;
360 * Output = the actual number of caret positions returned (may be zero)
361 * @caret_array: (out) (array length=caret_count): The array of caret positions found for the query
362 *
363 * Fetches a list of the caret positions defined for a ligature glyph in the GDEF
364 * table of the font. The list returned will begin at the offset provided.
365 *
366 * Note that a ligature that is formed from n characters will have n-1
367 * caret positions. The first character is not represented in the array,
368 * since its caret position is the glyph position.
369 *
370 * The positions returned by this function are 'unshaped', and will have to
371 * be fixed up for kerning that may be applied to the ligature glyph.
372 *
373 * Return value: Total number of ligature caret positions for @glyph.
374 *
375 **/
376unsigned int
377hb_ot_layout_get_ligature_carets (hb_font_t *font,
378 hb_direction_t direction,
379 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
380 unsigned int start_offset,
381 unsigned int *caret_count /* IN/OUT */,
382 hb_position_t *caret_array /* OUT */)
383{
384 return font->face->table.GDEF->table->get_lig_carets (font, direction, glyph_id: glyph, start_offset, caret_count, caret_array);
385}
386#endif
387

389/*
390 * GSUB/GPOS
391 */
392
393bool
394GSUB::is_blocklisted (hb_blob_t *blob HB_UNUSED,
395 hb_face_t *face) const
396{
397#ifdef HB_NO_OT_LAYOUT_BLOCKLIST
398 return false;
399#endif
400 return false;
401}
402
403bool
404GPOS::is_blocklisted (hb_blob_t *blob HB_UNUSED,
405 hb_face_t *face HB_UNUSED) const
406{
407#ifdef HB_NO_OT_LAYOUT_BLOCKLIST
408 return false;
409#endif
410 return false;
411}
412
413static const OT::GSUBGPOS&
414get_gsubgpos_table (hb_face_t *face,
415 hb_tag_t table_tag)
416{
417 switch (table_tag) {
418 case HB_OT_TAG_GSUB: return *face->table.GSUB->table;
419 case HB_OT_TAG_GPOS: return *face->table.GPOS->table;
420 default: return Null (OT::GSUBGPOS);
421 }
422}
423
424
425/**
426 * hb_ot_layout_table_get_script_tags:
427 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
428 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
429 * @start_offset: offset of the first script tag to retrieve
430 * @script_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of script tags to return;
431 * Output = the actual number of script tags returned (may be zero)
432 * @script_tags: (out) (array length=script_count): The array of #hb_tag_t script tags found for the query
433 *
434 * Fetches a list of all scripts enumerated in the specified face's GSUB table
435 * or GPOS table. The list returned will begin at the offset provided.
436 *
437 * Return value: Total number of script tags.
438 *
439 **/
440unsigned int
441hb_ot_layout_table_get_script_tags (hb_face_t *face,
442 hb_tag_t table_tag,
443 unsigned int start_offset,
444 unsigned int *script_count /* IN/OUT */,
445 hb_tag_t *script_tags /* OUT */)
446{
447 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
448
449 return g.get_script_tags (start_offset, script_count, script_tags);
450}
451
452#define HB_OT_TAG_LATIN_SCRIPT HB_TAG ('l', 'a', 't', 'n')
453
454/**
455 * hb_ot_layout_table_find_script:
456 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
457 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
458 * @script_tag: #hb_tag_t of the script tag requested
459 * @script_index: (out): The index of the requested script tag
460 *
461 * Fetches the index if a given script tag in the specified face's GSUB table
462 * or GPOS table.
463 *
464 * Return value: `true` if the script is found, `false` otherwise
465 *
466 **/
467hb_bool_t
468hb_ot_layout_table_find_script (hb_face_t *face,
469 hb_tag_t table_tag,
470 hb_tag_t script_tag,
471 unsigned int *script_index /* OUT */)
472{
473 static_assert ((OT::Index::NOT_FOUND_INDEX == HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_SCRIPT_INDEX), "");
474 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
475
476 if (g.find_script_index (tag: script_tag, index: script_index))
477 return true;
478
479 /* try finding 'DFLT' */
480 if (g.find_script_index (HB_OT_TAG_DEFAULT_SCRIPT, index: script_index))
481 return false;
482
483 /* try with 'dflt'; MS site has had typos and many fonts use it now :(.
484 * including many versions of DejaVu Sans Mono! */
485 if (g.find_script_index (HB_OT_TAG_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE, index: script_index))
486 return false;
487
488 /* try with 'latn'; some old fonts put their features there even though
489 they're really trying to support Thai, for example :( */
490 if (g.find_script_index (HB_OT_TAG_LATIN_SCRIPT, index: script_index))
491 return false;
492
493 if (script_index) *script_index = HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_SCRIPT_INDEX;
494 return false;
495}
496
497#ifndef HB_DISABLE_DEPRECATED
498/**
499 * hb_ot_layout_table_choose_script:
500 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
501 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
502 * @script_tags: Array of #hb_tag_t script tags
503 * @script_index: (out): The index of the chosen script
504 * @chosen_script: (out): #hb_tag_t of the chosen script
505 *
506 * Deprecated since 2.0.0
507 **/
508hb_bool_t
509hb_ot_layout_table_choose_script (hb_face_t *face,
510 hb_tag_t table_tag,
511 const hb_tag_t *script_tags,
512 unsigned int *script_index /* OUT */,
513 hb_tag_t *chosen_script /* OUT */)
514{
515 const hb_tag_t *t;
516 for (t = script_tags; *t; t++);
517 return hb_ot_layout_table_select_script (face, table_tag, script_count: t - script_tags, script_tags, script_index, chosen_script);
518}
519#endif
520
521/**
522 * hb_ot_layout_table_select_script:
523 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
524 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
525 * @script_count: Number of script tags in the array
526 * @script_tags: Array of #hb_tag_t script tags
527 * @script_index: (out) (optional): The index of the requested script
528 * @chosen_script: (out) (optional): #hb_tag_t of the requested script
529 *
530 * Selects an OpenType script for @table_tag from the @script_tags array.
531 *
532 * If the table does not have any of the requested scripts, then `DFLT`,
533 * `dflt`, and `latn` tags are tried in that order. If the table still does not
534 * have any of these scripts, @script_index is set to
535 * #HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_SCRIPT_INDEX and @chosen_script is set to #HB_TAG_NONE.
536 *
537 * Return value:
538 * `true` if one of the requested scripts is selected, `false` if a fallback
539 * script is selected or if no scripts are selected.
540 *
541 * Since: 2.0.0
542 **/
543hb_bool_t
544hb_ot_layout_table_select_script (hb_face_t *face,
545 hb_tag_t table_tag,
546 unsigned int script_count,
547 const hb_tag_t *script_tags,
548 unsigned int *script_index /* OUT */,
549 hb_tag_t *chosen_script /* OUT */)
550{
551 static_assert ((OT::Index::NOT_FOUND_INDEX == HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_SCRIPT_INDEX), "");
552 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
553 unsigned int i;
554
555 for (i = 0; i < script_count; i++)
556 {
557 if (g.find_script_index (tag: script_tags[i], index: script_index))
558 {
559 if (chosen_script)
560 *chosen_script = script_tags[i];
561 return true;
562 }
563 }
564
565 /* try finding 'DFLT' */
566 if (g.find_script_index (HB_OT_TAG_DEFAULT_SCRIPT, index: script_index)) {
567 if (chosen_script)
568 *chosen_script = HB_OT_TAG_DEFAULT_SCRIPT;
569 return false;
570 }
571
572 /* try with 'dflt'; MS site has had typos and many fonts use it now :( */
573 if (g.find_script_index (HB_OT_TAG_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE, index: script_index)) {
574 if (chosen_script)
575 *chosen_script = HB_OT_TAG_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE;
576 return false;
577 }
578
579 /* try with 'latn'; some old fonts put their features there even though
580 they're really trying to support Thai, for example :( */
581 if (g.find_script_index (HB_OT_TAG_LATIN_SCRIPT, index: script_index)) {
582 if (chosen_script)
583 *chosen_script = HB_OT_TAG_LATIN_SCRIPT;
584 return false;
585 }
586
587 if (script_index) *script_index = HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_SCRIPT_INDEX;
588 if (chosen_script)
589 *chosen_script = HB_TAG_NONE;
590 return false;
591}
592
593
594/**
595 * hb_ot_layout_table_get_feature_tags:
596 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
597 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
598 * @start_offset: offset of the first feature tag to retrieve
599 * @feature_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of feature tags to return;
600 * Output = the actual number of feature tags returned (may be zero)
601 * @feature_tags: (out) (array length=feature_count): Array of feature tags found in the table
602 *
603 * Fetches a list of all feature tags in the given face's GSUB or GPOS table.
604 * Note that there might be duplicate feature tags, belonging to different
605 * script/language-system pairs of the table.
606 *
607 * Return value: Total number of feature tags.
608 *
609 * Since: 0.6.0
610 *
611 **/
612unsigned int
613hb_ot_layout_table_get_feature_tags (hb_face_t *face,
614 hb_tag_t table_tag,
615 unsigned int start_offset,
616 unsigned int *feature_count /* IN/OUT */,
617 hb_tag_t *feature_tags /* OUT */)
618{
619 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
620
621 return g.get_feature_tags (start_offset, feature_count, feature_tags);
622}

624
625/**
626 * hb_ot_layout_table_find_feature:
627 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
628 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
629 * @feature_tag: The #hb_tag_t of the requested feature tag
630 * @feature_index: (out): The index of the requested feature
631 *
632 * Fetches the index for a given feature tag in the specified face's GSUB table
633 * or GPOS table.
634 *
635 * Return value: `true` if the feature is found, `false` otherwise
636 *
637 * Since: 0.6.0
638 *
639 **/
640bool
641hb_ot_layout_table_find_feature (hb_face_t *face,
642 hb_tag_t table_tag,
643 hb_tag_t feature_tag,
644 unsigned int *feature_index /* OUT */)
645{
646 static_assert ((OT::Index::NOT_FOUND_INDEX == HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_FEATURE_INDEX), "");
647 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
648
649 unsigned int num_features = g.get_feature_count ();
650 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_features; i++)
651 {
652 if (feature_tag == g.get_feature_tag (i)) {
653 if (feature_index) *feature_index = i;
654 return true;
655 }
656 }
657
658 if (feature_index) *feature_index = HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_FEATURE_INDEX;
659 return false;
660}

665 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
666 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
667 * @script_index: The index of the requested script tag
668 * @start_offset: offset of the first language tag to retrieve
669 * @language_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of language tags to return;
670 * Output = the actual number of language tags returned (may be zero)
671 * @language_tags: (out) (array length=language_count): Array of language tags found in the table
672 *
673 * Fetches a list of language tags in the given face's GSUB or GPOS table, underneath
674 * the specified script index. The list returned will begin at the offset provided.
675 *
676 * Return value: Total number of language tags.
677 *
678 * Since: 0.6.0
679 *

681unsigned int
682hb_ot_layout_script_get_language_tags (hb_face_t *face,

686 unsigned int *language_count /* IN/OUT */,
687 hb_tag_t *language_tags /* OUT */)
688{
689 const OT::Script &s = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag).get_script (i: script_index);
690
691 return s.get_lang_sys_tags (start_offset, lang_sys_count: language_count, lang_sys_tags: language_tags);
692}

729/**
730 * hb_ot_layout_script_select_language2:
731 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
732 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
733 * @script_index: The index of the requested script tag
734 * @language_count: The number of languages in the specified script
735 * @language_tags: The array of language tags
736 * @language_index: (out): The index of the chosen language
737 * @chosen_language: (out): #hb_tag_t of the chosen language
738 *
739 * Fetches the index of the first language tag fom @language_tags that is present
740 * in the specified face's GSUB or GPOS table, underneath the specified script
741 * index.
742 *
743 * If none of the given language tags is found, `false` is returned and
744 * @language_index is set to #HB_OT_LAYOUT_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE_INDEX and
745 * @chosen_language is set to #HB_TAG_NONE.
746 *
747 * Return value: `true` if one of the given language tags is found, `false` otherwise
748 *
749 * Since: 7.0.0
750 **/
751hb_bool_t
752hb_ot_layout_script_select_language2 (hb_face_t *face,
753 hb_tag_t table_tag,
754 unsigned int script_index,
755 unsigned int language_count,
756 const hb_tag_t *language_tags,
757 unsigned int *language_index /* OUT */,
758 hb_tag_t *chosen_language /* OUT */)
759{
760 static_assert ((OT::Index::NOT_FOUND_INDEX == HB_OT_LAYOUT_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE_INDEX), "");
761 const OT::Script &s = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag).get_script (i: script_index);
762 unsigned int i;
763
764 for (i = 0; i < language_count; i++)
765 {
766 if (s.find_lang_sys_index (tag: language_tags[i], index: language_index))
767 {
768 if (chosen_language)
769 *chosen_language = language_tags[i];
770 return true;
771 }
772 }
773
774 /* try finding 'dflt' */
775 if (s.find_lang_sys_index (HB_OT_TAG_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE, index: language_index))
776 {
777 if (chosen_language)
778 *chosen_language = HB_OT_TAG_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE;
779 return false;
780 }
781
782 if (language_index)
783 *language_index = HB_OT_LAYOUT_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE_INDEX;
784 if (chosen_language)
785 *chosen_language = HB_TAG_NONE;
786 return false;
787}

856 * hb_ot_layout_language_get_required_feature:
857 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
858 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
859 * @script_index: The index of the requested script tag
860 * @language_index: The index of the requested language tag
861 * @feature_index: (out): The index of the requested feature
862 * @feature_tag: (out): The #hb_tag_t of the requested feature
863 *
864 * Fetches the tag of a requested feature index in the given face's GSUB or GPOS table,
865 * underneath the specified script and language.
866 *
867 * Return value: `true` if the feature is found, `false` otherwise
868 *
869 * Since: 0.9.30

871hb_bool_t
872hb_ot_layout_language_get_required_feature (hb_face_t *face,
873 hb_tag_t table_tag,
874 unsigned int script_index,
875 unsigned int language_index,
876 unsigned int *feature_index /* OUT */,
877 hb_tag_t *feature_tag /* OUT */)
878{

880 const OT::LangSys &l = g.get_script (i: script_index).get_lang_sys (i: language_index);
881
882 unsigned int index = l.get_required_feature_index ();
883 if (feature_index) *feature_index = index;
884 if (feature_tag) *feature_tag = g.get_feature_tag (i: index);
885
886 return l.has_required_feature ();
887}

926/**
927 * hb_ot_layout_language_get_feature_tags:
928 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
929 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
930 * @script_index: The index of the requested script tag
931 * @language_index: The index of the requested language tag
932 * @start_offset: offset of the first feature tag to retrieve
933 * @feature_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of feature tags to return;
934 * Output = the actual number of feature tags returned (may be zero)
935 * @feature_tags: (out) (array length=feature_count): The array of #hb_tag_t feature tags found for the query
936 *
937 * Fetches a list of all features in the specified face's GSUB table
938 * or GPOS table, underneath the specified script and language. The list
939 * returned will begin at the offset provided.
940 *
941 * Return value: Total number of feature tags.
942 *
943 * Since: 0.6.0
944 *
945 **/
946unsigned int
947hb_ot_layout_language_get_feature_tags (hb_face_t *face,
948 hb_tag_t table_tag,
949 unsigned int script_index,
950 unsigned int language_index,
951 unsigned int start_offset,
952 unsigned int *feature_count /* IN/OUT */,
953 hb_tag_t *feature_tags /* OUT */)
954{
955 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
956 const OT::LangSys &l = g.get_script (i: script_index).get_lang_sys (i: language_index);
957
958 static_assert ((sizeof (unsigned int) == sizeof (hb_tag_t)), "");
959 unsigned int ret = l.get_feature_indexes (start_offset, feature_count, feature_indexes: (unsigned int *) feature_tags);
960
961 if (feature_tags) {
962 unsigned int count = *feature_count;
963 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
964 feature_tags[i] = g.get_feature_tag (i: (unsigned int) feature_tags[i]);
965 }
966
967 return ret;
968}

971/**
972 * hb_ot_layout_language_find_feature:
973 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
974 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
975 * @script_index: The index of the requested script tag
976 * @language_index: The index of the requested language tag
977 * @feature_tag: #hb_tag_t of the feature tag requested
978 * @feature_index: (out): The index of the requested feature
979 *
980 * Fetches the index of a given feature tag in the specified face's GSUB table
981 * or GPOS table, underneath the specified script and language.
982 *
983 * Return value: `true` if the feature is found, `false` otherwise
984 *
985 * Since: 0.6.0
986 *
987 **/
988hb_bool_t
989hb_ot_layout_language_find_feature (hb_face_t *face,
990 hb_tag_t table_tag,
991 unsigned int script_index,
992 unsigned int language_index,
993 hb_tag_t feature_tag,
994 unsigned int *feature_index /* OUT */)
995{
996 static_assert ((OT::Index::NOT_FOUND_INDEX == HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_FEATURE_INDEX), "");
997 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
998 const OT::LangSys &l = g.get_script (i: script_index).get_lang_sys (i: language_index);
999
1000 unsigned int num_features = l.get_feature_count ();
1001 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_features; i++) {
1002 unsigned int f_index = l.get_feature_index (i);
1003
1004 if (feature_tag == g.get_feature_tag (i: f_index)) {
1005 if (feature_index) *feature_index = f_index;
1006 return true;
1007 }
1008 }
1009
1010 if (feature_index) *feature_index = HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_FEATURE_INDEX;
1011 return false;
1012}

1051/**
1052 * hb_ot_layout_table_get_lookup_count:

1069
1070
1071struct hb_collect_features_context_t
1072{
1073 hb_collect_features_context_t (hb_face_t *face,
1074 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1075 hb_set_t *feature_indices_,
1076 const hb_tag_t *features)
1077
1078 : g (get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag)),
1079 feature_indices (feature_indices_),
1080 has_feature_filter (false),
1081 script_count (0),langsys_count (0), feature_index_count (0)
1082 {
1083 compute_feature_filter (features);
1084 }
1085
1086 void compute_feature_filter (const hb_tag_t *features)
1087 {
1088 if (features == nullptr)
1089 {
1090 has_feature_filter = false;
1091 return;
1092 }
1093
1094 has_feature_filter = true;
1095 hb_set_t features_set;
1096 for (; *features; features++)
1097 features_set.add (g: *features);
1098
1099 for (unsigned i = 0; i < g.get_feature_count (); i++)
1100 {
1101 hb_tag_t tag = g.get_feature_tag (i);
1102 if (features_set.has (k: tag))
1103 feature_indices_filter.add(g: i);
1104 }
1105 }
1106
1107 bool visited (const OT::Script &s)
1108 {
1109 /* We might have Null() object here. Don't want to involve
1110 * that in the memoize. So, detect empty objects and return. */
1111 if (unlikely (!s.has_default_lang_sys () &&
1112 !s.get_lang_sys_count ()))
1113 return true;
1114
1115 if (script_count++ > HB_MAX_SCRIPTS)
1116 return true;
1117
1118 return visited (p: s, visited_set&: visited_script);
1119 }
1120 bool visited (const OT::LangSys &l)
1121 {
1122 /* We might have Null() object here. Don't want to involve
1123 * that in the memoize. So, detect empty objects and return. */
1124 if (unlikely (!l.has_required_feature () &&
1125 !l.get_feature_count ()))
1126 return true;
1127
1128 if (langsys_count++ > HB_MAX_LANGSYS)
1129 return true;
1130
1131 return visited (p: l, visited_set&: visited_langsys);
1132 }
1133
1134 bool visited_feature_indices (unsigned count)
1135 {
1136 feature_index_count += count;
1137 return feature_index_count > HB_MAX_FEATURE_INDICES;
1138 }
1139
1140 private:
1141 template <typename T>
1142 bool visited (const T &p, hb_set_t &visited_set)
1143 {
1144 hb_codepoint_t delta = (hb_codepoint_t) ((uintptr_t) &p - (uintptr_t) &g);
1145 if (visited_set.has (k: delta))
1146 return true;
1147
1148 visited_set.add (g: delta);
1149 return false;
1150 }
1151
1152 public:
1153 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g;
1154 hb_set_t *feature_indices;
1155 hb_set_t feature_indices_filter;
1156 bool has_feature_filter;
1157
1158 private:
1159 hb_set_t visited_script;
1160 hb_set_t visited_langsys;
1161 unsigned int script_count;
1162 unsigned int langsys_count;
1163 unsigned int feature_index_count;
1164};
1165
1166static void
1167langsys_collect_features (hb_collect_features_context_t *c,
1168 const OT::LangSys &l)
1169{
1170 if (c->visited (l)) return;
1171
1172 if (!c->has_feature_filter)
1173 {
1174 /* All features. */
1175 if (l.has_required_feature () && !c->visited_feature_indices (count: 1))
1176 c->feature_indices->add (g: l.get_required_feature_index ());
1177
1178 // TODO(garretrieger): filter out indices >= feature count?
1179 if (!c->visited_feature_indices (count: l.featureIndex.len))
1180 l.add_feature_indexes_to (feature_indexes: c->feature_indices);
1181 }
1182 else
1183 {
1184 if (c->feature_indices_filter.is_empty()) return;
1185 unsigned int num_features = l.get_feature_count ();
1186 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_features; i++)
1187 {
1188 unsigned int feature_index = l.get_feature_index (i);
1189 if (!c->feature_indices_filter.has (k: feature_index)) continue;
1190
1191 c->feature_indices->add (g: feature_index);
1192 c->feature_indices_filter.del (g: feature_index);
1193 }
1194 }
1195}
1196
1197static void
1198script_collect_features (hb_collect_features_context_t *c,
1199 const OT::Script &s,
1200 const hb_tag_t *languages)
1201{
1202 if (c->visited (s)) return;
1203
1204 if (!languages)
1205 {
1206 /* All languages. */
1207 if (s.has_default_lang_sys ())
1208 langsys_collect_features (c,
1209 l: s.get_default_lang_sys ());
1210
1211
1212 unsigned int count = s.get_lang_sys_count ();
1213 for (unsigned int language_index = 0; language_index < count; language_index++)
1214 langsys_collect_features (c,
1215 l: s.get_lang_sys (i: language_index));
1216 }
1217 else
1218 {
1219 for (; *languages; languages++)
1220 {
1221 unsigned int language_index;
1222 if (s.find_lang_sys_index (tag: *languages, index: &language_index))
1223 langsys_collect_features (c,
1224 l: s.get_lang_sys (i: language_index));
1225
1226 }
1227 }
1228}
1229
1230
1231/**
1232 * hb_ot_layout_collect_features:
1233 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1234 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
1235 * @scripts: (nullable) (array zero-terminated=1): The array of scripts to collect features for,
1236 * terminated by %HB_TAG_NONE
1237 * @languages: (nullable) (array zero-terminated=1): The array of languages to collect features for,
1238 * terminated by %HB_TAG_NONE
1239 * @features: (nullable) (array zero-terminated=1): The array of features to collect,
1240 * terminated by %HB_TAG_NONE
1241 * @feature_indexes: (out): The array of feature indexes found for the query
1242 *
1243 * Fetches a list of all feature indexes in the specified face's GSUB table
1244 * or GPOS table, underneath the specified scripts, languages, and features.
1245 * If no list of scripts is provided, all scripts will be queried. If no list
1246 * of languages is provided, all languages will be queried. If no list of
1247 * features is provided, all features will be queried.
1248 *
1249 * Since: 1.8.5
1250 **/
1251void
1252hb_ot_layout_collect_features (hb_face_t *face,
1253 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1254 const hb_tag_t *scripts,
1255 const hb_tag_t *languages,
1256 const hb_tag_t *features,
1257 hb_set_t *feature_indexes /* OUT */)
1258{
1259 hb_collect_features_context_t c (face, table_tag, feature_indexes, features);
1260 if (!scripts)
1261 {
1262 /* All scripts. */
1263 unsigned int count = c.g.get_script_count ();
1264 for (unsigned int script_index = 0; script_index < count; script_index++)
1265 script_collect_features (c: &c,
1266 s: c.g.get_script (i: script_index),
1267 languages);
1268 }
1269 else
1270 {
1271 for (; *scripts; scripts++)
1272 {
1273 unsigned int script_index;
1274 if (c.g.find_script_index (tag: *scripts, index: &script_index))
1275 script_collect_features (c: &c,
1276 s: c.g.get_script (i: script_index),
1277 languages);
1278 }
1279 }
1280}
1281
1282
1283/**
1284 * hb_ot_layout_collect_lookups:
1285 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1286 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
1287 * @scripts: (nullable) (array zero-terminated=1): The array of scripts to collect lookups for,
1288 * terminated by %HB_TAG_NONE
1289 * @languages: (nullable) (array zero-terminated=1): The array of languages to collect lookups for,
1290 * terminated by %HB_TAG_NONE
1291 * @features: (nullable) (array zero-terminated=1): The array of features to collect lookups for,
1292 * terminated by %HB_TAG_NONE
1293 * @lookup_indexes: (out): The array of lookup indexes found for the query
1294 *
1295 * Fetches a list of all feature-lookup indexes in the specified face's GSUB
1296 * table or GPOS table, underneath the specified scripts, languages, and
1297 * features. If no list of scripts is provided, all scripts will be queried.
1298 * If no list of languages is provided, all languages will be queried. If no
1299 * list of features is provided, all features will be queried.
1300 *
1301 * Since: 0.9.8
1302 **/
1303void
1304hb_ot_layout_collect_lookups (hb_face_t *face,
1305 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1306 const hb_tag_t *scripts,
1307 const hb_tag_t *languages,
1308 const hb_tag_t *features,
1309 hb_set_t *lookup_indexes /* OUT */)
1310{
1311 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
1312
1313 hb_set_t feature_indexes;
1314 hb_ot_layout_collect_features (face, table_tag, scripts, languages, features, feature_indexes: &feature_indexes);
1315
1316 for (hb_codepoint_t feature_index = HB_SET_VALUE_INVALID;
1317 hb_set_next (set: &feature_indexes, codepoint: &feature_index);)
1318 g.get_feature (i: feature_index).add_lookup_indexes_to (lookup_indexes);
1319
1320 g.feature_variation_collect_lookups (feature_indexes: &feature_indexes, feature_substitutes_map: nullptr, lookup_indexes);
1321}
1322

1324#ifndef HB_NO_LAYOUT_COLLECT_GLYPHS
1325/**
1326 * hb_ot_layout_lookup_collect_glyphs:
1327 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1328 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
1329 * @lookup_index: The index of the feature lookup to query
1330 * @glyphs_before: (out): Array of glyphs preceding the substitution range
1331 * @glyphs_input: (out): Array of input glyphs that would be substituted by the lookup
1332 * @glyphs_after: (out): Array of glyphs following the substitution range
1333 * @glyphs_output: (out): Array of glyphs that would be the substituted output of the lookup
1334 *
1335 * Fetches a list of all glyphs affected by the specified lookup in the
1336 * specified face's GSUB table or GPOS table.
1337 *
1338 * Since: 0.9.7
1339 **/
1340void
1341hb_ot_layout_lookup_collect_glyphs (hb_face_t *face,
1342 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1343 unsigned int lookup_index,
1344 hb_set_t *glyphs_before, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1345 hb_set_t *glyphs_input, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1346 hb_set_t *glyphs_after, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1347 hb_set_t *glyphs_output /* OUT. May be NULL */)
1348{
1349 OT::hb_collect_glyphs_context_t c (face,
1350 glyphs_before,
1351 glyphs_input,
1352 glyphs_after,
1353 glyphs_output);
1354
1355 switch (table_tag)
1356 {
1357 case HB_OT_TAG_GSUB:
1358 {
1359 const OT::SubstLookup& l = face->table.GSUB->table->get_lookup (i: lookup_index);
1360 l.collect_glyphs (c: &c);
1361 return;
1362 }
1363 case HB_OT_TAG_GPOS:
1364 {
1365 const OT::PosLookup& l = face->table.GPOS->table->get_lookup (i: lookup_index);
1366 l.collect_glyphs (c: &c);
1367 return;
1368 }
1369 }
1370}
1371#endif

1380 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
1381 * @coords: The variation coordinates to query
1382 * @num_coords: The number of variation coordinates
1383 * @variations_index: (out): The array of feature variations found for the query
1384 *
1385 * Fetches a list of feature variations in the specified face's GSUB table
1386 * or GPOS table, at the specified variation coordinates.
1387 *
1388 * Return value: `true` if feature variations were found, `false` otherwise.
1389 *
1390 * Since: 1.4.0
1391 *
1392 **/
1393hb_bool_t
1394hb_ot_layout_table_find_feature_variations (hb_face_t *face,
1395 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1396 const int *coords,
1397 unsigned int num_coords,
1398 unsigned int *variations_index /* out */)
1399{
1400 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
1401
1402 return g.find_variations_index (coords, num_coords, index: variations_index);
1403}

1406/**
1407 * hb_ot_layout_feature_with_variations_get_lookups:
1408 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1409 * @table_tag: #HB_OT_TAG_GSUB or #HB_OT_TAG_GPOS
1410 * @feature_index: The index of the feature to query
1411 * @variations_index: The index of the feature variation to query
1412 * @start_offset: offset of the first lookup to retrieve
1413 * @lookup_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of lookups to return;
1414 * Output = the actual number of lookups returned (may be zero)
1415 * @lookup_indexes: (out) (array length=lookup_count): The array of lookups found for the query
1416 *
1417 * Fetches a list of all lookups enumerated for the specified feature, in
1418 * the specified face's GSUB table or GPOS table, enabled at the specified
1419 * variations index. The list returned will begin at the offset provided.
1420 *
1421 * Return value: Total number of lookups.
1422 *
1423 * Since: 1.4.0
1424 *
1425 **/
1426unsigned int
1427hb_ot_layout_feature_with_variations_get_lookups (hb_face_t *face,
1428 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1429 unsigned int feature_index,
1430 unsigned int variations_index,
1431 unsigned int start_offset,
1432 unsigned int *lookup_count /* IN/OUT */,
1433 unsigned int *lookup_indexes /* OUT */)
1434{
1435 static_assert ((OT::FeatureVariations::NOT_FOUND_INDEX == HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_VARIATIONS_INDEX), "");
1436 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
1437
1438 const OT::Feature &f = g.get_feature_variation (feature_index, variations_index);
1439
1440 return f.get_lookup_indexes (start_index: start_offset, lookup_count, lookup_tags: lookup_indexes);
1441}

1466
1467/**
1468 * hb_ot_layout_lookup_would_substitute:
1469 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1470 * @lookup_index: The index of the lookup to query
1471 * @glyphs: The sequence of glyphs to query for substitution
1472 * @glyphs_length: The length of the glyph sequence
1473 * @zero_context: #hb_bool_t indicating whether pre-/post-context are disallowed
1474 * in substitutions
1475 *
1476 * Tests whether a specified lookup in the specified face would
1477 * trigger a substitution on the given glyph sequence.
1478 *
1479 * Return value: `true` if a substitution would be triggered, `false` otherwise
1480 *
1481 * Since: 0.9.7
1482 **/
1483hb_bool_t
1484hb_ot_layout_lookup_would_substitute (hb_face_t *face,
1485 unsigned int lookup_index,
1486 const hb_codepoint_t *glyphs,
1487 unsigned int glyphs_length,
1488 hb_bool_t zero_context)
1489{
1490 auto &gsub = face->table.GSUB;
1491 if (unlikely (lookup_index >= gsub->lookup_count)) return false;
1492 OT::hb_would_apply_context_t c (face, glyphs, glyphs_length, (bool) zero_context);
1493
1494 const OT::SubstLookup& l = gsub->table->get_lookup (i: lookup_index);
1495 auto *accel = gsub->get_accel (lookup_index);
1496 return accel && l.would_apply (c: &c, accel);
1497}

1506 * class and other properties are set on the glyphs in the buffer.

1509void
1510hb_ot_layout_substitute_start (hb_font_t *font,
1511 hb_buffer_t *buffer)
1512{
1513 _hb_ot_layout_set_glyph_props (font, buffer);
1514}
1515
1516/**
1517 * hb_ot_layout_lookup_substitute_closure:
1518 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1519 * @lookup_index: index of the feature lookup to query
1520 * @glyphs: (out): Array of glyphs comprising the transitive closure of the lookup
1521 *
1522 * Compute the transitive closure of glyphs needed for a
1523 * specified lookup.
1524 *
1525 * Since: 0.9.7
1526 **/
1527void
1528hb_ot_layout_lookup_substitute_closure (hb_face_t *face,
1529 unsigned int lookup_index,
1530 hb_set_t *glyphs /* OUT */)
1531{
1532 hb_map_t done_lookups_glyph_count;
1533 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::unique_ptr<hb_set_t>> done_lookups_glyph_set;
1534 OT::hb_closure_context_t c (face, glyphs, &done_lookups_glyph_count, &done_lookups_glyph_set);
1535
1536 const OT::SubstLookup& l = face->table.GSUB->table->get_lookup (i: lookup_index);
1537
1538 l.closure (c: &c, this_index: lookup_index);
1539}
1540
1541/**
1542 * hb_ot_layout_lookups_substitute_closure:
1543 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1544 * @lookups: The set of lookups to query
1545 * @glyphs: (out): Array of glyphs comprising the transitive closure of the lookups
1546 *
1547 * Compute the transitive closure of glyphs needed for all of the
1548 * provided lookups.
1549 *
1550 * Since: 1.8.1
1551 **/
1552void
1553hb_ot_layout_lookups_substitute_closure (hb_face_t *face,
1554 const hb_set_t *lookups,
1555 hb_set_t *glyphs /* OUT */)
1556{
1557 hb_map_t done_lookups_glyph_count;
1558 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::unique_ptr<hb_set_t>> done_lookups_glyph_set;
1559 OT::hb_closure_context_t c (face, glyphs, &done_lookups_glyph_count, &done_lookups_glyph_set);
1560 const GSUB& gsub = *face->table.GSUB->table;
1561
1562 unsigned int iteration_count = 0;
1563 unsigned int glyphs_length;
1564 do
1565 {
1566 c.reset_lookup_visit_count ();
1567 glyphs_length = glyphs->get_population ();
1568 if (lookups)
1569 {
1570 for (hb_codepoint_t lookup_index = HB_SET_VALUE_INVALID; hb_set_next (set: lookups, codepoint: &lookup_index);)
1571 gsub.get_lookup (i: lookup_index).closure (c: &c, this_index: lookup_index);
1572 }
1573 else
1574 {
1575 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < gsub.get_lookup_count (); i++)
1576 gsub.get_lookup (i).closure (c: &c, this_index: i);
1577 }
1578 } while (iteration_count++ <= HB_CLOSURE_MAX_STAGES &&
1579 glyphs_length != glyphs->get_population ());
1580}

1646
1647#ifndef HB_NO_LAYOUT_FEATURE_PARAMS
1648/**
1649 * hb_ot_layout_get_size_params:
1650 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1651 * @design_size: (out): The design size of the face
1652 * @subfamily_id: (out): The identifier of the face within the font subfamily
1653 * @subfamily_name_id: (out): The ‘name’ table name ID of the face within the font subfamily
1654 * @range_start: (out): The minimum size of the recommended size range for the face
1655 * @range_end: (out): The maximum size of the recommended size range for the face
1656 *
1657 * Fetches optical-size feature data (i.e., the `size` feature from GPOS). Note that
1658 * the subfamily_id and the subfamily name string (accessible via the subfamily_name_id)
1659 * as used here are defined as pertaining only to fonts within a font family that differ
1660 * specifically in their respective size ranges; other ways to differentiate fonts within
1661 * a subfamily are not covered by the `size` feature.
1662 *
1663 * For more information on this distinction, see the [`size` feature documentation](
1664 * https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_pt#tag-size).
1665 *
1666 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
1667 *
1668 * Since: 0.9.10
1669 **/
1670hb_bool_t
1671hb_ot_layout_get_size_params (hb_face_t *face,
1672 unsigned int *design_size, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1673 unsigned int *subfamily_id, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1674 hb_ot_name_id_t *subfamily_name_id, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1675 unsigned int *range_start, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1676 unsigned int *range_end /* OUT. May be NULL */)
1677{
1678 const GPOS &gpos = *face->table.GPOS->table;
1679 const hb_tag_t tag = HB_TAG ('s','i','z','e');
1680
1681 unsigned int num_features = gpos.get_feature_count ();
1682 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_features; i++)
1683 {
1684 if (tag == gpos.get_feature_tag (i))
1685 {
1686 const OT::Feature &f = gpos.get_feature (i);
1687 const OT::FeatureParamsSize &params = f.get_feature_params ().get_size_params (tag);
1688
1689 if (params.designSize)
1690 {
1691 if (design_size) *design_size = params.designSize;
1692 if (subfamily_id) *subfamily_id = params.subfamilyID;
1693 if (subfamily_name_id) *subfamily_name_id = params.subfamilyNameID;
1694 if (range_start) *range_start = params.rangeStart;
1695 if (range_end) *range_end = params.rangeEnd;
1696
1697 return true;
1698 }
1699 }
1700 }
1701
1702 if (design_size) *design_size = 0;
1703 if (subfamily_id) *subfamily_id = 0;
1704 if (subfamily_name_id) *subfamily_name_id = HB_OT_NAME_ID_INVALID;
1705 if (range_start) *range_start = 0;
1706 if (range_end) *range_end = 0;
1707
1708 return false;
1709}
1710
1711
1712/**
1713 * hb_ot_layout_feature_get_name_ids:
1714 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1715 * @table_tag: table tag to query, "GSUB" or "GPOS".
1716 * @feature_index: index of feature to query.
1717 * @label_id: (out) (optional): The ‘name’ table name ID that specifies a string
1718 * for a user-interface label for this feature. (May be NULL.)
1719 * @tooltip_id: (out) (optional): The ‘name’ table name ID that specifies a string
1720 * that an application can use for tooltip text for this
1721 * feature. (May be NULL.)
1722 * @sample_id: (out) (optional): The ‘name’ table name ID that specifies sample text
1723 * that illustrates the effect of this feature. (May be NULL.)
1724 * @num_named_parameters: (out) (optional): Number of named parameters. (May be zero.)
1725 * @first_param_id: (out) (optional): The first ‘name’ table name ID used to specify
1726 * strings for user-interface labels for the feature
1727 * parameters. (Must be zero if numParameters is zero.)
1728 *
1729 * Fetches name indices from feature parameters for "Stylistic Set" ('ssXX') or
1730 * "Character Variant" ('cvXX') features.
1731 *
1732 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
1733 *
1734 * Since: 2.0.0
1735 **/
1736hb_bool_t
1737hb_ot_layout_feature_get_name_ids (hb_face_t *face,
1738 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1739 unsigned int feature_index,
1740 hb_ot_name_id_t *label_id, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1741 hb_ot_name_id_t *tooltip_id, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1742 hb_ot_name_id_t *sample_id, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1743 unsigned int *num_named_parameters, /* OUT. May be NULL */
1744 hb_ot_name_id_t *first_param_id /* OUT. May be NULL */)
1745{
1746 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
1747
1748 hb_tag_t feature_tag = g.get_feature_tag (i: feature_index);
1749 const OT::Feature &f = g.get_feature (i: feature_index);
1750
1751 const OT::FeatureParams &feature_params = f.get_feature_params ();
1752 if (&feature_params != &Null (OT::FeatureParams))
1753 {
1754 const OT::FeatureParamsStylisticSet& ss_params =
1755 feature_params.get_stylistic_set_params (tag: feature_tag);
1756 if (&ss_params != &Null (OT::FeatureParamsStylisticSet)) /* ssXX */
1757 {
1758 if (label_id) *label_id = ss_params.uiNameID;
1759 // ssXX features don't have the rest
1760 if (tooltip_id) *tooltip_id = HB_OT_NAME_ID_INVALID;
1761 if (sample_id) *sample_id = HB_OT_NAME_ID_INVALID;
1762 if (num_named_parameters) *num_named_parameters = 0;
1763 if (first_param_id) *first_param_id = HB_OT_NAME_ID_INVALID;
1764 return true;
1765 }
1766 const OT::FeatureParamsCharacterVariants& cv_params =
1767 feature_params.get_character_variants_params (tag: feature_tag);
1768 if (&cv_params != &Null (OT::FeatureParamsCharacterVariants)) /* cvXX */
1769 {
1770 if (label_id) *label_id = cv_params.featUILableNameID;
1771 if (tooltip_id) *tooltip_id = cv_params.featUITooltipTextNameID;
1772 if (sample_id) *sample_id = cv_params.sampleTextNameID;
1773 if (num_named_parameters) *num_named_parameters = cv_params.numNamedParameters;
1774 if (first_param_id) *first_param_id = cv_params.firstParamUILabelNameID;
1775 return true;
1776 }
1777 }
1778
1779 if (label_id) *label_id = HB_OT_NAME_ID_INVALID;
1780 if (tooltip_id) *tooltip_id = HB_OT_NAME_ID_INVALID;
1781 if (sample_id) *sample_id = HB_OT_NAME_ID_INVALID;
1782 if (num_named_parameters) *num_named_parameters = 0;
1783 if (first_param_id) *first_param_id = HB_OT_NAME_ID_INVALID;
1784 return false;
1785}
1786/**
1787 * hb_ot_layout_feature_get_characters:
1788 * @face: #hb_face_t to work upon
1789 * @table_tag: table tag to query, "GSUB" or "GPOS".
1790 * @feature_index: index of feature to query.
1791 * @start_offset: offset of the first character to retrieve
1792 * @char_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of characters to return;
1793 * Output = the actual number of characters returned (may be zero)
1794 * @characters: (out caller-allocates) (array length=char_count): A buffer pointer.
1795 * The Unicode codepoints of the characters for which this feature provides
1796 * glyph variants.
1797 *
1798 * Fetches a list of the characters defined as having a variant under the specified
1799 * "Character Variant" ("cvXX") feature tag.
1800 *
1801 * Return value: Number of total sample characters in the cvXX feature.
1802 *
1803 * Since: 2.0.0
1804 **/
1805unsigned int
1806hb_ot_layout_feature_get_characters (hb_face_t *face,
1807 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1808 unsigned int feature_index,
1809 unsigned int start_offset,
1810 unsigned int *char_count, /* IN/OUT. May be NULL */
1811 hb_codepoint_t *characters /* OUT. May be NULL */)
1812{
1813 const OT::GSUBGPOS &g = get_gsubgpos_table (face, table_tag);
1814 return g.get_feature (i: feature_index)
1815 .get_feature_params ()
1816 .get_character_variants_params(tag: g.get_feature_tag (i: feature_index))
1817 .get_characters (start_offset, char_count, chars: characters);
1818}
1819#endif
1820
1821
1822/*
1823 * Parts of different types are implemented here such that they have direct
1824 * access to GSUB/GPOS lookups.
1825 */
1826
1827
1828struct GSUBProxy
1829{
1830 static constexpr unsigned table_index = 0u;
1831 static constexpr bool always_inplace = false;
1832 typedef OT::SubstLookup Lookup;
1833
1834 GSUBProxy (hb_face_t *face) :
1835 accel (*face->table.GSUB) {}
1836
1837 const GSUB::accelerator_t &accel;
1838};
1839
1840struct GPOSProxy
1841{
1842 static constexpr unsigned table_index = 1u;
1843 static constexpr bool always_inplace = true;
1844 typedef OT::PosLookup Lookup;
1845
1846 GPOSProxy (hb_face_t *face) :
1847 accel (*face->table.GPOS) {}
1848
1849 const GPOS::accelerator_t &accel;
1850};
1851
1852
1853static inline bool
1854apply_forward (OT::hb_ot_apply_context_t *c,
1855 const OT::hb_ot_layout_lookup_accelerator_t &accel,
1856 unsigned subtable_count)
1857{
1858 bool use_cache = accel.cache_enter (c);
1859
1860 bool ret = false;
1861 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
1862 while (buffer->idx < buffer->len && buffer->successful)
1863 {
1864 bool applied = false;
1865 if (accel.digest.may_have (g: buffer->cur().codepoint) &&
1866 (buffer->cur().mask & c->lookup_mask) &&
1867 c->check_glyph_property (info: &buffer->cur(), match_props: c->lookup_props))
1868 {
1869 applied = accel.apply (c, subtables_count: subtable_count, use_cache);
1870 }
1871
1872 if (applied)
1873 ret = true;
1874 else
1875 (void) buffer->next_glyph ();
1876 }
1877
1878 if (use_cache)
1879 accel.cache_leave (c);
1880
1881 return ret;
1882}
1883
1884static inline bool
1885apply_backward (OT::hb_ot_apply_context_t *c,
1886 const OT::hb_ot_layout_lookup_accelerator_t &accel,
1887 unsigned subtable_count)
1888{
1889 bool ret = false;
1890 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
1891 do
1892 {
1893 if (accel.digest.may_have (g: buffer->cur().codepoint) &&
1894 (buffer->cur().mask & c->lookup_mask) &&
1895 c->check_glyph_property (info: &buffer->cur(), match_props: c->lookup_props))
1896 ret |= accel.apply (c, subtables_count: subtable_count, use_cache: false);
1897
1898 /* The reverse lookup doesn't "advance" cursor (for good reason). */
1899 buffer->idx--;
1900
1901 }
1902 while ((int) buffer->idx >= 0);
1903 return ret;
1904}
1905
1906template <typename Proxy>
1907static inline bool
1908apply_string (OT::hb_ot_apply_context_t *c,
1909 const typename Proxy::Lookup &lookup,
1910 const OT::hb_ot_layout_lookup_accelerator_t &accel)
1911{
1912 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
1913 unsigned subtable_count = lookup.get_subtable_count ();
1914
1915 if (unlikely (!buffer->len || !c->lookup_mask))
1916 return false;
1917
1918 bool ret = false;
1919
1920 c->set_lookup_props (lookup.get_props ());
1921
1922 if (likely (!lookup.is_reverse ()))
1923 {
1924 /* in/out forward substitution/positioning */
1925 if (!Proxy::always_inplace)
1926 buffer->clear_output ();
1927
1928 buffer->idx = 0;
1929 ret = apply_forward (c, accel, subtable_count);
1930
1931 if (!Proxy::always_inplace)
1932 buffer->sync ();
1933 }
1934 else
1935 {
1936 /* in-place backward substitution/positioning */
1937 assert (!buffer->have_output);
1938 buffer->idx = buffer->len - 1;
1939 ret = apply_backward (c, accel, subtable_count);
1940 }
1941
1942 return ret;
1943}
1944
1945template <typename Proxy>
1946inline void hb_ot_map_t::apply (const Proxy &proxy,
1947 const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
1948 hb_font_t *font,
1949 hb_buffer_t *buffer) const
1950{
1951 const unsigned int table_index = proxy.table_index;
1952 unsigned int i = 0;
1953 OT::hb_ot_apply_context_t c (table_index, font, buffer);
1954 c.set_recurse_func (Proxy::Lookup::template dispatch_recurse_func<OT::hb_ot_apply_context_t>);
1955
1956 for (unsigned int stage_index = 0; stage_index < stages[table_index].length; stage_index++)
1957 {
1958 const stage_map_t *stage = &stages[table_index][stage_index];
1959 for (; i < stage->last_lookup; i++)
1960 {
1961 auto &lookup = lookups[table_index][i];
1962
1963 unsigned int lookup_index = lookup.index;
1964
1965 auto *accel = proxy.accel.get_accel (lookup_index);
1966 if (unlikely (!accel)) continue;
1967
1968 if (buffer->messaging () &&
1969 !buffer->message (font, fmt: "start lookup %u feature '%c%c%c%c'", lookup_index, HB_UNTAG (lookup.feature_tag))) continue;
1970
1971 /* c.digest is a digest of all the current glyphs in the buffer
1972 * (plus some past glyphs).
1973 *
1974 * Only try applying the lookup if there is any overlap. */
1975 if (accel->digest.may_have (c.digest))
1976 {
1977 c.set_lookup_index (lookup_index);
1978 c.set_lookup_mask (lookup.mask);
1979 c.set_auto_zwj (lookup.auto_zwj);
1980 c.set_auto_zwnj (lookup.auto_zwnj);
1981 c.set_random (lookup.random);
1982 c.set_per_syllable (lookup.per_syllable);
1983
1984 apply_string<Proxy> (&c,
1985 proxy.accel.table->get_lookup (lookup_index),
1986 *accel);
1987 }
1988 else if (buffer->messaging ())
1989 (void) buffer->message (font, fmt: "skipped lookup %u feature '%c%c%c%c' because no glyph matches", lookup_index, HB_UNTAG (lookup.feature_tag));
1990
1991 if (buffer->messaging ())
1992 (void) buffer->message (font, fmt: "end lookup %u feature '%c%c%c%c'", lookup_index, HB_UNTAG (lookup.feature_tag));
1993 }
1994
1995 if (stage->pause_func)
1996 {
1997 if (stage->pause_func (plan, font, buffer))
1998 {
1999 /* Refresh working buffer digest since buffer changed. */
2000 c.digest = buffer->digest ();
2001 }
2002 }
2003 }
2004}
2005
2006void hb_ot_map_t::substitute (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan, hb_font_t *font, hb_buffer_t *buffer) const
2007{
2008 GSUBProxy proxy (font->face);
2009 if (buffer->messaging () &&
2010 !buffer->message (font, fmt: "start table GSUB")) return;
2011 apply (proxy, plan, font, buffer);
2012 if (buffer->messaging ())
2013 (void) buffer->message (font, fmt: "end table GSUB");
2014}
2015
2016void hb_ot_map_t::position (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan, hb_font_t *font, hb_buffer_t *buffer) const
2017{
2018 GPOSProxy proxy (font->face);
2019 if (buffer->messaging () &&
2020 !buffer->message (font, fmt: "start table GPOS")) return;
2021 apply (proxy, plan, font, buffer);
2022 if (buffer->messaging ())
2023 (void) buffer->message (font, fmt: "end table GPOS");
2024}
2025
2026void
2027hb_ot_layout_substitute_lookup (OT::hb_ot_apply_context_t *c,
2028 const OT::SubstLookup &lookup,
2029 const OT::hb_ot_layout_lookup_accelerator_t &accel)
2030{
2031 apply_string<GSUBProxy> (c, lookup, accel);
2032}
2033
2034#ifndef HB_NO_BASE
2035/**
2036 * hb_ot_layout_get_horizontal_baseline_tag_for_script:
2037 * @script: a script tag.
2038 *
2039 * Fetches the dominant horizontal baseline tag used by @script.
2040 *
2041 * Return value: dominant baseline tag for the @script.
2042 *
2043 * Since: 4.0.0
2044 **/
2045hb_ot_layout_baseline_tag_t
2046hb_ot_layout_get_horizontal_baseline_tag_for_script (hb_script_t script)
2047{
2048 /* Keep in sync with hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback */
2049 switch ((int) script)
2050 {
2051 /* Unicode-1.1 additions */
2052 case HB_SCRIPT_BENGALI:
2053 case HB_SCRIPT_DEVANAGARI:
2054 case HB_SCRIPT_GUJARATI:
2055 case HB_SCRIPT_GURMUKHI:
2056 /* Unicode-2.0 additions */
2057 case HB_SCRIPT_TIBETAN:
2058 /* Unicode-4.0 additions */
2059 case HB_SCRIPT_LIMBU:
2060 /* Unicode-4.1 additions */
2061 case HB_SCRIPT_SYLOTI_NAGRI:
2062 /* Unicode-5.0 additions */
2063 case HB_SCRIPT_PHAGS_PA:
2064 /* Unicode-5.2 additions */
2065 case HB_SCRIPT_MEETEI_MAYEK:
2066 /* Unicode-6.1 additions */
2067 case HB_SCRIPT_SHARADA:
2068 case HB_SCRIPT_TAKRI:
2069 /* Unicode-7.0 additions */
2070 case HB_SCRIPT_MODI:
2071 case HB_SCRIPT_SIDDHAM:
2072 case HB_SCRIPT_TIRHUTA:
2073 /* Unicode-9.0 additions */
2074 case HB_SCRIPT_MARCHEN:
2075 case HB_SCRIPT_NEWA:
2076 /* Unicode-10.0 additions */
2077 case HB_SCRIPT_SOYOMBO:
2078 case HB_SCRIPT_ZANABAZAR_SQUARE:
2079 /* Unicode-11.0 additions */
2080 case HB_SCRIPT_DOGRA:
2081 case HB_SCRIPT_GUNJALA_GONDI:
2082 /* Unicode-12.0 additions */
2083 case HB_SCRIPT_NANDINAGARI:
2084 return HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_HANGING;
2085
2086 /* Unicode-1.1 additions */
2087 case HB_SCRIPT_HANGUL:
2088 case HB_SCRIPT_HAN:
2089 case HB_SCRIPT_HIRAGANA:
2090 case HB_SCRIPT_KATAKANA:
2091 /* Unicode-3.0 additions */
2092 case HB_SCRIPT_BOPOMOFO:
2093 /* Unicode-9.0 additions */
2094 case HB_SCRIPT_TANGUT:
2095 /* Unicode-10.0 additions */
2096 case HB_SCRIPT_NUSHU:
2097 /* Unicode-13.0 additions */
2098 case HB_SCRIPT_KHITAN_SMALL_SCRIPT:
2099 return HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_FACE_BOTTOM_OR_LEFT;
2100
2101 default:
2102 return HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_ROMAN;
2103 }
2104}
2105
2106/**
2107 * hb_ot_layout_get_baseline:
2108 * @font: a font
2109 * @baseline_tag: a baseline tag
2110 * @direction: text direction.
2111 * @script_tag: script tag.
2112 * @language_tag: language tag, currently unused.
2113 * @coord: (out) (nullable): baseline value if found.
2114 *
2115 * Fetches a baseline value from the face.
2116 *
2117 * Return value: `true` if found baseline value in the font.
2118 *
2119 * Since: 2.6.0
2120 **/
2121hb_bool_t
2122hb_ot_layout_get_baseline (hb_font_t *font,
2123 hb_ot_layout_baseline_tag_t baseline_tag,
2124 hb_direction_t direction,
2125 hb_tag_t script_tag,
2126 hb_tag_t language_tag,
2127 hb_position_t *coord /* OUT. May be NULL. */)
2128{
2129 return font->face->table.BASE->get_baseline (font, baseline_tag, direction, script_tag, language_tag, base: coord);
2130}
2131
2132/**
2133 * hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback:
2134 * @font: a font
2135 * @baseline_tag: a baseline tag
2136 * @direction: text direction.
2137 * @script_tag: script tag.
2138 * @language_tag: language tag, currently unused.
2139 * @coord: (out): baseline value if found.
2140 *
2141 * Fetches a baseline value from the face, and synthesizes
2142 * it if the font does not have it.
2143 *
2144 * Since: 4.0.0
2145 **/
2146void
2147hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback (hb_font_t *font,
2148 hb_ot_layout_baseline_tag_t baseline_tag,
2149 hb_direction_t direction,
2150 hb_tag_t script_tag,
2151 hb_tag_t language_tag,
2152 hb_position_t *coord /* OUT */)
2153{
2154 if (hb_ot_layout_get_baseline (font,
2155 baseline_tag,
2156 direction,
2157 script_tag,
2158 language_tag,
2159 coord))
2160 return;
2161
2162 /* Synthesize missing baselines.
2163 * See https://www.w3.org/TR/css-inline-3/#baseline-synthesis-fonts
2164 */
2165 switch (baseline_tag)
2166 {
2167 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_ROMAN:
2168 *coord = 0; // FIXME origin ?
2169 break;
2170
2171 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_MATH:
2172 {
2173 hb_codepoint_t glyph;
2174 hb_glyph_extents_t extents;
2175 if (HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (direction) &&
2176 (hb_font_get_nominal_glyph (font, unicode: 0x2212u, glyph: &glyph) ||
2177 hb_font_get_nominal_glyph (font, unicode: '-', glyph: &glyph)) &&
2178 hb_font_get_glyph_extents (font, glyph, extents: &extents))
2179 {
2180 *coord = extents.y_bearing + extents.height / 2;
2181 }
2182 else
2183 {
2184 hb_position_t x_height = font->y_scale / 2;
2185#ifndef HB_NO_METRICS
2186 hb_ot_metrics_get_position_with_fallback (font, metrics_tag: HB_OT_METRICS_TAG_X_HEIGHT, position: &x_height);
2187#endif
2188 *coord = x_height / 2;
2189 }
2190 }
2191 break;
2192
2193 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_FACE_TOP_OR_RIGHT:
2194 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_FACE_BOTTOM_OR_LEFT:
2195 {
2196 hb_position_t embox_top, embox_bottom;
2197
2198 hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback (font,
2199 baseline_tag: HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_TOP_OR_RIGHT,
2200 direction,
2201 script_tag,
2202 language_tag,
2203 coord: &embox_top);
2204 hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback (font,
2205 baseline_tag: HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_BOTTOM_OR_LEFT,
2206 direction,
2207 script_tag,
2208 language_tag,
2209 coord: &embox_bottom);
2210
2211 if (baseline_tag == HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_FACE_TOP_OR_RIGHT)
2212 *coord = embox_top + (embox_bottom - embox_top) / 10;
2213 else
2214 *coord = embox_bottom + (embox_top - embox_bottom) / 10;
2215 }
2216 break;
2217
2218 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_TOP_OR_RIGHT:
2219 if (hb_ot_layout_get_baseline (font,
2220 baseline_tag: HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_BOTTOM_OR_LEFT,
2221 direction,
2222 script_tag,
2223 language_tag,
2224 coord))
2225 *coord += HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (direction) ? font->y_scale : font->x_scale;
2226 else
2227 {
2228 hb_font_extents_t font_extents;
2229 hb_font_get_extents_for_direction (font, direction, extents: &font_extents);
2230 *coord = font_extents.ascender;
2231 }
2232 break;
2233
2234 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_BOTTOM_OR_LEFT:
2235 if (hb_ot_layout_get_baseline (font,
2236 baseline_tag: HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_TOP_OR_RIGHT,
2237 direction,
2238 script_tag,
2239 language_tag,
2240 coord))
2241 *coord -= HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (direction) ? font->y_scale : font->x_scale;
2242 else
2243 {
2244 hb_font_extents_t font_extents;
2245 hb_font_get_extents_for_direction (font, direction, extents: &font_extents);
2246 *coord = font_extents.descender;
2247 }
2248 break;
2249
2250 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_HANGING:
2251 if (HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (direction))
2252 {
2253 hb_codepoint_t ch;
2254 hb_codepoint_t glyph;
2255 hb_glyph_extents_t extents;
2256
2257 /* Keep in sync with hb_ot_layout_get_horizontal_baseline_for_script */
2258 switch ((int) script_tag)
2259 {
2260 /* Unicode-1.1 additions */
2261 case HB_SCRIPT_BENGALI: ch = 0x0995u; break;
2262 case HB_SCRIPT_DEVANAGARI: ch = 0x0915u; break;
2263 case HB_SCRIPT_GUJARATI: ch = 0x0a95u; break;
2264 case HB_SCRIPT_GURMUKHI: ch = 0x0a15u; break;
2265 /* Unicode-2.0 additions */
2266 case HB_SCRIPT_TIBETAN: ch = 0x0f40u; break;
2267 /* Unicode-4.0 additions */
2268 case HB_SCRIPT_LIMBU: ch = 0x1901u; break;
2269 /* Unicode-4.1 additions */
2270 case HB_SCRIPT_SYLOTI_NAGRI: ch = 0xa807u; break;
2271 /* Unicode-5.0 additions */
2272 case HB_SCRIPT_PHAGS_PA: ch = 0xa840u; break;
2273 /* Unicode-5.2 additions */
2274 case HB_SCRIPT_MEETEI_MAYEK: ch = 0xabc0u; break;
2275 /* Unicode-6.1 additions */
2276 case HB_SCRIPT_SHARADA: ch = 0x11191u; break;
2277 case HB_SCRIPT_TAKRI: ch = 0x1168cu; break;
2278 /* Unicode-7.0 additions */
2279 case HB_SCRIPT_MODI: ch = 0x1160eu;break;
2280 case HB_SCRIPT_SIDDHAM: ch = 0x11590u; break;
2281 case HB_SCRIPT_TIRHUTA: ch = 0x1148fu; break;
2282 /* Unicode-9.0 additions */
2283 case HB_SCRIPT_MARCHEN: ch = 0x11c72u; break;
2284 case HB_SCRIPT_NEWA: ch = 0x1140eu; break;
2285 /* Unicode-10.0 additions */
2286 case HB_SCRIPT_SOYOMBO: ch = 0x11a5cu; break;
2287 case HB_SCRIPT_ZANABAZAR_SQUARE: ch = 0x11a0bu; break;
2288 /* Unicode-11.0 additions */
2289 case HB_SCRIPT_DOGRA: ch = 0x1180au; break;
2290 case HB_SCRIPT_GUNJALA_GONDI: ch = 0x11d6cu; break;
2291 /* Unicode-12.0 additions */
2292 case HB_SCRIPT_NANDINAGARI: ch = 0x119b0u; break;
2293 default: ch = 0; break;
2294 }
2295
2296 if (ch &&
2297 hb_font_get_nominal_glyph (font, unicode: ch, glyph: &glyph) &&
2298 hb_font_get_glyph_extents (font, glyph, extents: &extents))
2299 *coord = extents.y_bearing;
2300 else
2301 *coord = font->y_scale * 6 / 10; // FIXME makes assumptions about origin
2302 }
2303 else
2304 *coord = font->x_scale * 6 / 10; // FIXME makes assumptions about origin
2305 break;
2306
2307 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_CENTRAL:
2308 {
2309 hb_position_t top, bottom;
2310 hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback (font,
2311 baseline_tag: HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_TOP_OR_RIGHT,
2312 direction,
2313 script_tag,
2314 language_tag,
2315 coord: &top);
2316 hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback (font,
2317 baseline_tag: HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_EMBOX_BOTTOM_OR_LEFT,
2318 direction,
2319 script_tag,
2320 language_tag,
2321 coord: &bottom);
2322 *coord = (top + bottom) / 2;
2323
2324 }
2325 break;
2326
2327 case HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_FACE_CENTRAL:
2328 {
2329 hb_position_t top, bottom;
2330 hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback (font,
2331 baseline_tag: HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_FACE_TOP_OR_RIGHT,
2332 direction,
2333 script_tag,
2334 language_tag,
2335 coord: &top);
2336 hb_ot_layout_get_baseline_with_fallback (font,
2337 baseline_tag: HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_IDEO_FACE_BOTTOM_OR_LEFT,
2338 direction,
2339 script_tag,
2340 language_tag,
2341 coord: &bottom);
2342 *coord = (top + bottom) / 2;
2343
2344 }
2345 break;
2346
2347 case _HB_OT_LAYOUT_BASELINE_TAG_MAX_VALUE:
2348 default:
2349 *coord = 0;
2350 break;
2351 }
2352}
2353
2354#endif
2355
2356
2357struct hb_get_glyph_alternates_dispatch_t :
2358 hb_dispatch_context_t<hb_get_glyph_alternates_dispatch_t, unsigned>
2359{
2360 static return_t default_return_value () { return 0; }
2361 bool stop_sublookup_iteration (return_t r) const { return r; }
2362
2363 private:
2364 template <typename T, typename ...Ts> auto
2365 _dispatch (const T &obj, hb_priority<1>, Ts&&... ds) HB_AUTO_RETURN
2366 ( obj.get_glyph_alternates (std::forward<Ts> (ds)...) )
2367 template <typename T, typename ...Ts> auto
2368 _dispatch (const T &obj, hb_priority<0>, Ts&&... ds) HB_AUTO_RETURN
2369 ( default_return_value () )
2370 public:
2371 template <typename T, typename ...Ts> auto
2372 dispatch (const T &obj, Ts&&... ds) HB_AUTO_RETURN
2373 ( _dispatch (obj, hb_prioritize, std::forward<Ts> (ds)...) )
2374};

2376#ifndef HB_NO_LAYOUT_RARELY_USED
2377/**
2378 * hb_ot_layout_lookup_get_glyph_alternates:
2379 * @face: a face.
2380 * @lookup_index: index of the feature lookup to query.
2381 * @glyph: a glyph id.
2382 * @start_offset: starting offset.
2383 * @alternate_count: (inout) (optional): Input = the maximum number of alternate glyphs to return;
2384 * Output = the actual number of alternate glyphs returned (may be zero).
2385 * @alternate_glyphs: (out caller-allocates) (array length=alternate_count): A glyphs buffer.
2386 * Alternate glyphs associated with the glyph id.
2387 *
2388 * Fetches alternates of a glyph from a given GSUB lookup index.
2389 *
2390 * Return value: Total number of alternates found in the specific lookup index for the given glyph id.
2391 *
2392 * Since: 2.6.8
2393 **/
2394HB_EXTERN unsigned
2395hb_ot_layout_lookup_get_glyph_alternates (hb_face_t *face,
2396 unsigned lookup_index,
2397 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
2398 unsigned start_offset,
2399 unsigned *alternate_count /* IN/OUT. May be NULL. */,
2400 hb_codepoint_t *alternate_glyphs /* OUT. May be NULL. */)
2401{
2402 hb_get_glyph_alternates_dispatch_t c;
2403 const OT::SubstLookup &lookup = face->table.GSUB->table->get_lookup (i: lookup_index);
2404 auto ret = lookup.dispatch (c: &c, ds&: glyph, ds&: start_offset, ds&: alternate_count, ds&: alternate_glyphs);
2405 if (!ret && alternate_count) *alternate_count = 0;
2406 return ret;
2407}

2418 _dispatch (const T &obj, hb_priority<1>, Ts&&... ds) HB_AUTO_RETURN
2419 ( obj.position_single (std::forward<Ts> (ds)...) )
2420 template <typename T, typename ...Ts> auto
2421 _dispatch (const T &obj, hb_priority<0>, Ts&&... ds) HB_AUTO_RETURN
2422 ( default_return_value () )
2423 public:
2424 template <typename T, typename ...Ts> auto

2429/**
2430 * hb_ot_layout_lookup_get_optical_bound:
2431 * @font: a font.
2432 * @lookup_index: index of the feature lookup to query.
2433 * @direction: edge of the glyph to query.
2434 * @glyph: a glyph id.
2435 *
2436 * Fetches the optical bound of a glyph positioned at the margin of text.
2437 * The direction identifies which edge of the glyph to query.
2438 *
2439 * Return value: Adjustment value. Negative values mean the glyph will stick out of the margin.
2440 *
2441 * Since: 5.3.0
2442 **/
2443hb_position_t
2444hb_ot_layout_lookup_get_optical_bound (hb_font_t *font,
2445 unsigned lookup_index,
2446 hb_direction_t direction,
2447 hb_codepoint_t glyph)
2448{
2449 const OT::PosLookup &lookup = font->face->table.GPOS->table->get_lookup (i: lookup_index);
2450 hb_glyph_position_t pos = {.x_advance: 0};
2451 hb_position_single_dispatch_t c;
2452 lookup.dispatch (c: &c, ds&: font, ds&: direction, ds&: glyph, ds&: pos);
2453 hb_position_t ret = 0;
2454 switch (direction)
2455 {
2456 case HB_DIRECTION_LTR:
2457 ret = pos.x_offset;
2458 break;
2459 case HB_DIRECTION_RTL:
2460 ret = pos.x_advance - pos.x_offset;
2461 break;
2462 case HB_DIRECTION_TTB:
2463 ret = pos.y_offset;
2464 break;
2465 case HB_DIRECTION_BTT:
2466 ret = pos.y_advance - pos.y_offset;
2467 break;
2468 case HB_DIRECTION_INVALID:
2469 default:
2470 break;
2471 }
2472 return ret;
2473}
2474#endif

2476
2477#endif
